page.title: 19Local History
page.content: Old village of Cil-y-Cwm was known as Glan-dwr. it was situated in Cae Mawr, behind the smithy, and was burned down during Great Plague. A disused drovers pound may still be seen on outskirts of village. In main street, there is a wide gutter which was filld with butter milk for the geese being driven to market in Englnd. It would appear that Cil-y-cwm was once virtually self sufficient community. Within living memory, th village had 1 tailor,2 cobblers, 1 shoemaker, 1 blacksmith, 2 general stores (1 with post office) 2 dressmaekrs (1 travelling from farm to farm) 1 huckster, 1 cattle dealer, 1 woollen factory, 1 flour mill, 2 carpenters. The older people also remember a brass band and 2 football teams in the village.
